availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Joseph A. Mott (Caldwell co., ky, farmer )

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer. Caldwell County, Kentucky, native. Married to Lucinda T. Miller Mott in Caldwell County, Kentucky, on April 8, 1835. Father of William H. Mott, John D. Mott, Joseph B. Mott, Eliza A. Mott, Stephen B. Mott, Sarah J. Mott, Kitty Mott, Mary Mott, and Maggie Mott. Farmer in Caldwell County in 1850. Owned two enslaved persons in Caldwell County in 1850. Farmer in Princeton in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Princeton in 1860.

ab.bibl:

Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 1, p. 821.

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 220A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Fredonia, p. 438A.

Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Caldwell County Marriages, Film #000851644.
